article_title: L. Gordon Crovitz: Gentlemen Read Each Other's Mail
article_text:
Barack Obama was famously glued to his BlackBerry in 2008, but once in office he was told it was vulnerable to foreign spying. Even with special encryption software, he is now allowed to email only some 20 aides, family members and friends whose devices have similar protections.

America's inability to secure its president's communications puts in perspective last week's breathless leaks by Edward Snowden that the National Security Agency listens to the communications of other heads of state. The White House went into a...
